fields.title: Subject graph help fixed
fields.text:
Activity and Payments
In this frame there a is graph showing the Zone Minutes you and your partner earned each day.  The vertical axis shows the number of Zone Minutes earned each day.  Your activity is marked in #my_label#, and your partner's activity is in #partner_label#. 
 
For each day that your check in, you will earn $#fixed_pay#.  We will send you a payment via PayPal once per week.  This weekly payment will be the total earnings from the seven previous days.  Your currently weekly earnings are shown on the right side of the graph next to "Sum".
 
Your current zone minutes today will be marked with a #my_label# circle.
 
If you or #partner_label# are unable to check in, a no-pay "NP" marker will be shown.

fields.title: Subject check in help fixed
fields.text:
Check In
 
Each day you must visit this site and check in.  To be eligible for check in, you must do two things:
1) You must have worn the Fitbit for the specified amount of time listed in this frame.
2) You must have synced the Fitbit to your phone within the last 30 minutes.
 
Sometimes there will be a Qualtrics survey you must complete before check in.  You will not be able to check in until you complete the survey.  If a survey is required, the check in button will be replaced with a link to the survey.
 
If you do not check in on a particular day, you will not receive earnings for that day. 
 
Once you meet the eligibility requirements for check in, you can check in again later in the day if you earn more Zone Minutes.
 
Zone minutes are shown on your Fitbit next to the icon. 
For more information on how Fitbit calculates Zone Minutes visit their website:
https://blog.fitbit.com/active-zone-minutes/

fields.title: Subject check in help group
fields.text:
Check In
 
Each day you must visit this site and check in.  To be eligible for check in, you must do two things:
1) You must have worn the Fitbit for the specified amount of time listed in this frame.
2) You must have synced the Fitbit to your phone within the last 30 minutes.
 
Sometimes there will be a Qualtrics survey you must complete before check in.  You will not be able to check in until you complete the survey.  If a survey is required, the check in button will be replaced with a link to the survey.
 
If you do not check in on a particular day, you will not receive earnings for that day.  Additionally, your partner will not receive group earnings for that day.
 
Once you meet the eligibility requirements for check in, you can check in again later in the day if you earn more Zone Minutes.
 
Zone minutes are shown on your Fitbit next to the icon. 
For more information on how Fitbit calculates Zone Minutes visit their website:
https://blog.fitbit.com/active-zone-minutes/

fields.title: Subject graph help group
fields.text:
Activity and Payments
In this frame there a is graph showing the Zone Minutes you and your partner earned each day along with the corresponding earnings.  The left side vertical axis shows the number of Zone Minutes earned each day.  The right side vertical axis shows the corresponding earnings.  There are two ways to earn money each day.  You earn money for your individual Zone Minutes and you earn money for group Zone Minutes.  Your activity is marked in #my_label#, and your partner's activity is in #partner_label#.
 
Individual Zone Minutes are the number of minutes you earned today and are paid according to this schedule:
#Individual_Zone_Minutes#
 
Group Zone Minutes are the minimum of your individual Zone Minutes and your partner's individual Zone Minutes.  In other words, we will use the lower of either your Zone Minutes or your partner's Zone Minutes and pay each of you, the same amount, according to this schedule:
#Group_Zone_Minutes#
 
Your daily cash earnings are the sum of your individual earnings and your group earnings.  We will send you a payment from PayPal to your Chapman email once per week.  This weekly payment is the total earnings from the seven previous days.  Your currently weekly earnings are shown on the right side of the graph next to "Sum".
 
Your current zone minutes today will be marked with a #my_label# circle.
 
If you or your partner are unable to check in, a no-pay "NP" marker will be shown.

fields.title: Subject chat help
fields.text:
Chat

You can chat with your partner using the Chat frame.  You are free to discuss any aspects of the study.  Please do not use inappropriate language, make threats or reveal personal information not pertinent to the study.

fields.title: Subject check in help no pay
fields.text:
Check In
 
Each day you must visit this site and check in.  To be eligible for check in, you must do two things:
1) You must have worn the Fitbit for the specified amount of time listed in this frame.
2) You must have synced the Fitbit to your phone within the last 30 minutes.
 
Sometimes there will be a Qualtrics survey you must complete before check in.  You will not be able to check in until you complete the survey.  If a survey is required, the check in button will be replaced with a link to the survey.
 
If you do not check in each day, you will not be allowed to keep your Fitbit at the end of the study.
 
Once you meet the eligibility requirements for check in, you can check in again later in the day if you earn more Zone Minutes.
 
Zone minutes are shown on your Fitbit next to the icon. 
For more information on how Fitbit calculates Zone Minutes visit their website:
https://blog.fitbit.com/active-zone-minutes/

fields.title: Subject graph help no pay
fields.text:
Activity and Payments
In this frame there a is graph showing the Zone Minutes you and your partner earned each day.  The vertical axis shows the number of Zone Minutes earned each day.  Your activity is marked in #my_label#, and your partner's activity is in #partner_label#. 
 
If you check in each day for the remainder of the experiment you may keep the Fitbit.
 
Your current zone minutes today will be marked with a #my_label# circle.
 
If you or #partner_label# are unable to check in, a no-pay "NP" marker will be shown.

fields.title: Staff Graph
fields.text: This section shows a graph of the median zone minutes for active users across the session.

fields.title: Staff Subject List
fields.text:
To edit a subject's info, click on the desired cell in the table.

Upload player list: Takes a recruiter exported user list and uploads it to the session.  The the first user in the list be asigned to player #1 and so on.

ID Label: Label used to describe the subject's color.

Name: The subject's full name.

Email: The subject's email to which the login link will be sent.

Student ID: Used to generate a recruiter compatible payment list.

Group Number: Subjects in the same group will see each other's zone minutes in their graph and be able to communicate in chat.

Color: RGB hex code for subject's color used in the graph.

Active: If a subject is deactivated, they can no longer participate in the experiment.  Invitations and earnings will only be generated for active subjects.

Consent: The subject has agreed to the consent form.

Shareable link: Unique login link used by an individual subject.  This link should be kept private to each subject.  This link can be included automatically in the email invitations.  See Control help for more information.

Connected: The subject is currently connected to the server.

History: A period-by-period record of subject activity and payments.  Force check in allows the experimenter to override check in constraints and mark the subject checked in.  A record of this is stored in the data file.

Chat: A the subject's chat record with their group.

fields.title: Staff Control
fields.text:
The Control section houses the major operational functionality of the session.

Start Session: This begins the session and should be done once the parameters are set.  After a session is started, parameters and the start date cannot be changed.  After a session has started, upload the subject list.

Reset connection status: If a subject's connection to the server is abandoned, the server may not recognize it has been lost and will still show it as connected.  This will reset the connection status to disconnected for all subjects.

End Early: Set today as the last day of the experiment.  This will smoothly end the experiment tomorrow. Only available to elevated users.

Reset Experiment: Clears the subject data and returns the session to a pre-start state.  This is primarily useful for testing.  Only available to elevated users.

Send Invitations: Send an email to all active subjects.  This email has two optional variables that can be added: "[contact email]" and "[log in link]".  The server will auto-insert this information when sending the email.

fields.title: Staff Payments
fields.text:
Each row in the table corresponds to a payment block defined in the parameters.  The button in each row will first attempt to back-pull any missing metrics for the subject from the previous day.  It will then copy recruiter compatible results to the clipboard.

Subjects should be paid on the day following each pay-block date range.

fields.title: Staff Data
fields.text:
This section houses the data file download functionality.

Summary: A period-by-period record of subject activity and payment.

Heart Rate: A period-by-period, minute-by-minute record of heart rate measurements.

Activities: A record of activities (i.e., running, biking, etc.) either auto-detected or manually recorded by the Fitbit.

Chat: The chat record of each group.

fields.title: Staff Parameters Control
fields.text:
Download Parameter Set: Download the parameter set into a file JSON format.  This is primarily useful for moving parameter sets between servers.
 
Upload Parameter Set: Take a JSON formatted file from the above download and load those parameters in.  There is limited validation during this process.  The downloaded file is not intended to be edited.  Parameter edits should be done with the forms on this page.
 
Import Parameter Set: Copy the parameters from another session into this one.  This is the recommended way of setting up a new session.

fields.title: Staff Parameters General
fields.text:
Parameters cannot be edited once a session has been started.

Graph Max Y Value: Top of the left side Y-axis on subject screen.

Enable Chat: Allow groups to chat with each other.

Consent Form Required: Require subjects to agree to the specified consent form before participating.

Consent Form File Name: The filename of the consent form.  Consent forms need to be manually added to the Github repo.

fields.title: Staff Parameters Periods
fields.text:
The day-by-day parameters are defined here.  To edit a value, click on it.

Period type:

  • No Pay: Subjects should check in daily to keep their Fitbit, but do not earn cash.  Set all pay rates to zero.
  • Fixed Pay: Hides the group pay information. Set all individual pay rates the same.  Set group pay rates to zero.
  • Group Pay: Shows the group pay information.

Wrist Minutes: The number of minutes each day the subject must wear the Fitbit before checking in.

Survey: Require subjects to complete a survey before checking in.

Notice: Show an on-screen notice to the subjects; this is useful for explaining environmental changes.

Graphs: Up to two graphs can be displayed to subjects.  An optional back graph and a required front graph.  The back graph has muted colors and is intended to show past activity. The front graph is overlaid on top of the back graph. The back and front graph range sizes must match.  The earnings shown on the graph are for the front graph.

Payment Blocks: This defines which days should be paid together in one lump sum to the subjects.  Payment blocks should be contiguous.

Payment by zone minutes:  All treatments use the same payment scheme.  If a subject reaches a defined zone minute level, they will receive the specified Individual payment for that day.  The subject will also earn the group bonus for the lowest zone minute earner in their group.  For example, if the lowest zone minute earner in the group were 12 minutes, all group members would receive the group bonus defined for this period for 12 minutes.

fields.title: Staff Parameters Players
fields.text:
Set the number of subjects in the experiment here.
 
Label: Name of the color used for the subject.
 
Color: RGB Hex color used in the graph for the subject.

fields.title: Staff Parameters Zone Minutes
fields.text:
Set the number of zone minute earnings groups here.
 
Value: If the subject has this number of zone minutes or less, and more than the preceding value, they fall into this bucket.
 
Label: The displayed text to define this zone minute group.

fields.title: Subject graph help individual pay
fields.text:
Activity and Payments
In this frame there a is graph showing the Zone Minutes you and your partner earned each day along with the corresponding earnings.  The left side vertical axis shows the number of Zone Minutes earned each day.  The right side vertical axis shows the corresponding earnings.  You earn money for the Zone Minutes you earn each day.  Your activity is marked in #my_label#, and your partner's activity is in #partner_label#.
 
We will pay you for your daily Zone Minutes are according to this schedule:
#Individual_Zone_Minutes#
 
#partner_label# will also be paid according to the above schedule based on the Zone Minutes they earn each day.
 
We will send you a payment from PayPal to your Chapman email once per week.  This weekly payment is your total earnings from the seven previous days.  Your currently weekly earnings are shown on the right side of the graph next to "Sum".
 
Your current zone minutes today will be marked with a #my_label# circle.
 
If you or #partner_label# are unable to check in, a no-pay "NP" marker will be shown.

fields.title: Subject check in help individual pay
fields.text:
Check In
 
Each day you must visit this site and check in.  To be eligible for check in, you must do two things:
1) You must have worn the Fitbit for the specified amount of time listed in this frame.
2) You must have synced the Fitbit to your phone within the last 30 minutes.
 
Sometimes there will be a Qualtrics survey you must complete before check in.  You will not be able to check in until you complete the survey.  If a survey is required, the check in button will be replaced with a link to the survey.
 
If you do not check in on a particular day, you will not receive earnings for that day.
 
Once you meet the eligibility requirements for check in, you can check in again later in the day if you earn more Zone Minutes.
 
Zone minutes are shown on your Fitbit next to the icon. 
For more information on how Fitbit calculates Zone Minutes visit their website:
https://blog.fitbit.com/active-zone-minutes/
